variants.Description in input context: A missense mutation in SNCA (p.G37E) associated with Parkinson's disease.
A missense mutation in SNCA (p.G44E) linked to early-onset Parkinson's disease.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant SNCA constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing p.G37E showed a 40% reduction in viability compared to wild-type controls.
Cells expressing p.G44E exhibited a 55% decrease in viability compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated three times with independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each biological replicate was measured in triplicate using the MTT assay.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability â‰¥ 85% compared to wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability < 70% compared to wild-type controls.
